column4: i've created a user account on my ubuntu system. I've tried connecting to my ubuntu computer via my windows computer (using PuttY). When i enter the login details. it gives me Access Denied message. And i dont know why?
you need to 'sudo apt-get install ssh' on the ubuntu system
: it says Setting up ssh
when it's done, you'll be able to connect through putty
: how do i know when its done?
the $ prompt comes back
: still doesnt work. When i use Putty. it connects to my computer. But refuses entry. Says access Denied
try if you can ssh from your ubuntu box to itself: 'ssh localhost'
: it says: Linux Home 2.6 blah blah
: it looks like it works thru the shell
can you ping your Ubuntu box from the Windows one?
: yep pings fine. its got to do something with the login . i just dnot understand
your sshd is working. You've proven that.
where did you get the output you pastebinned?
: by typing sudo iptables -L
you did remember that usernames are case-sensitive?
: Yes
does it really say 'access denied' or is it 'connection refused'?
: Access Denied
is that in the putty terminal, or does it come up as a dialog?
: Putty terminal
ah.
I think you've used sudo to change something in your $HOME/.ssh -- do a 'sudo chown -R $USER:$USER $HOME/.ssh' to fix that
